info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Broome and southwestern Chenango Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chenango Forks, or 8 miles east of Greater Binghamton Airport, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Coventry, Bainbridge, Afton, Harpursville, Sanitaria Springs, Nineveh, Chenango Forks, Chenango Valley State Park and Port Crane. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 88 between 4 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
